The book aims to raise funds to aid war sufferers in the devastated districts of France during World War I, focusing on various culinary traditions from Allied nations. It is likely to be of interest to readers who appreciate the culinary arts and want to support a humanitarian cause.  The opening of the book introduces its noble purpose: to assist those affected by the destruction of farms and livelihoods due to wartime invasions in France. The compilers, Grace Clergue Harrison and Gertrude Clergue, emphasize the plight of those struggling to restore their agricultural communities. The text serves not only as a cookbook but also as an appeal for compassion and support for the victims of war while celebrating the culinary diversity of allied nations.
